title: How to Make Creamy Broccoli Soup

steps.headline: Chop the broccoli.
steps.description: Wash a few bunches of broccoli. Take a sharp knife and carefully trim away the tough end of the stalks. Throw away the ends and any leaves. Chop the broccoli florets and the tender, small stalks. Set the chopped broccoli aside. You should end up with about 4 cups (700 g) of chopped broccoli.

steps.headline: Saute the onion.
steps.description: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a medium-sized pot over medium heat. Chop one onion and add it to the heated oil. Saute the onion over medium heat for about 10 minutes. The onion should become translucent. Avoid overcooking the onion to the point that it becomes caramelized or crispy.

steps.headline: Add the stock and potato.
steps.description: Pour in 4 cups (1 liter) of vegetable or chicken stock. Peel and chop 1 russet potato into 1" pieces and add it to the pot. Turn the heat to low and let it simmer (bubble lightly) for about 12 minutes. The potato should be just about tender if you poke it with a fork.

steps.headline: Puree the soup.
steps.description: Add the chopped broccoli to the pot and continue simmering the soup for another 10 minutes. Check the broccoli and potato for tenderness. They should be soft enough to puree in a blender or with a handheld blender until the soup becomes smooth. If you want to puree the soup in the blender, carefully ladle the hot soup into the blender and puree it in batches.

steps.headline: Add the cream and season the soup.
steps.description: Return the pureed soup to the pot and keep it on low heat. Pour in 1/2 cup (120 ml) of heavy cream and stir the soup. Ensure that the soup doesn't return to a boil since this will make the heavy cream separate. Add salt and pepper to taste. To make this recipe vegan, leave out the cream and use vegetable stock instead of chicken stock.

steps.headline: Saute the onion and garlic.
steps.description: Heat 4 tablespoons (55 g) of butter in a large pot over medium heat. Carefully dice one small onion and mince one garlic clove with a sharp knife. Add these to the pot of melted butter. Saute the onion and garlic for 3 to 5 minutes. The onion should be tender and almost translucent. The garlic should be fragrant.

steps.headline: Make a roux and add the half-and-half.
steps.description: Stir in 1/4 cup (20 g) of flour to the sauteed onion and garlic. Continue to stir and cook the roux for 3 to 4 minutes. It should thicken up and turn pale in color. Slowly whisk in 1 cup (240 ml) of half-and-half until the mixture is smooth. You'll need to stir or whisk the roux constantly to avoid lumps. If you do end up with a few lumps, don't worry since you'll be pureeing the soup.

steps.headline: Stir in the broth and seasonings.
steps.description: Whisk in 4 cups (1 liter) of vegetable or chicken broth along with 1 bay leaf, salt, and pepper (to taste). Once the soup begins to bubble, reduce the heat to medium-low so that it's simmering. Simmer the soup for about 10 minutes. Keep the soup uncovered as it cooks and stir it occasionally to keep the soup from sticking to the pot.

steps.headline: Add the broccoli and carrot.
steps.description: Chop 1 1/4 pounds of broccoli florets and stems. You should end up with about 4 cups of diced broccoli. You'll also need to peel and dice 1 large carrot or two carrots, if they're small. Add the chopped vegetables to the soup and simmer the soup for 15 to 20 minutes. Taste the soup at this point and add salt and pepper. You can also take out the bay leaf.

steps.headline: Puree the soup and add the cheese.
steps.description: Puree the soup using a blender or handheld immersion blender. Make the soup as smooth as you like. Pour the soup back into the pot on the stove and add 8 ounces (about 2 1/2 cups) of coarsely grated sharp cheddar cheese. Whisk the cheese in till it melts. Since the broccoli should be completely tender, you can leave some chunks for a more textured soup.

Whisk in 4 cups (1 liter) of vegetable or chicken broth along with 1 bay leaf, salt, and pepper (to taste). Once the soup begins to bubble, reduce the heat to medium-low so that it's simmering. Chop 1 1/4 pounds of broccoli florets and stems. You should end up with about 4 cups of diced broccoli. You'll also need to peel and dice 1 large carrot or two carrots, if they're small. Puree the soup and add the cheese. Puree the soup using a blender or handheld immersion blender. Make the soup as smooth as you like. Pour the soup back into the pot on the stove and add 8 ounces (about 2 1/2 cups) of coarsely grated sharp cheddar cheese. Whisk the cheese in till it melts. Since the broccoli should be completely tender, you can leave some chunks for a more textured soup.
